greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Matrix defined by: a(i,0) = 0, a(i,j) = i*Fibonacci(j-1) + Fibonacci(j), for j > 0; read by antidiagonals.
comment: Lower triangular version is at A117501. - _Ross La Haye_, Apr 12 2006
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for the first 50 rows, flattened
formula: a(i, 0) = 0, a(i, j) = i*Fibonacci(j-1) + Fibonacci(j), for j > 0. a(i, 0) = 0, a(i, 1) = 1, a(i, 2) = i+1, a(i, j) = a(i, j-1) + a(i, j-2), for j > 2.
Sum_{j=0..i+1} a(i-j+1, j) - Sum_{j=0..i} a(i-j, j) = A001595(i). - _Ross La Haye_, Jun 03 2006
results.author: _Ross La Haye_, Aug 11 2005; corrected Apr 14 2006
ext: More terms from _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 07 2017
